channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Witnessing the spectacle of synchronous fireflies is ‘like magic’
item.description: For a few weeks in late spring, thousands of fireflies emerge at the Congaree National Park in South Carolina to blink in synchrony. Scientists are trying to learn their secrets and to protect them.
item.content:encoded:
For a few weeks in late spring, thousands of fireflies emerge at the Congaree National Park in South Carolina to blink in synchrony. Scientists are trying to learn their secrets and to protect them.

(Image credit: Sam Wolfe for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Air travel has gone to the dogs — literally. Here’s what to know about BARK Air
item.description: BARK Air says it built its experience "dog first," offering perks like puppucchinos and pheromone blankets. It's flying between New York and LA or London and plans to add more routes soon.
item.content:encoded:
BARK Air says it built its experience "dog first," offering perks like puppucchinos and pheromone blankets. It's flying between New York and LA or London and plans to add more routes soon.

(Image credit: Joe Gall)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Aid trucks begin entering Gaza under agreement with Egypt to bypass Rafah
item.description: Aid trucks entered Gaza from southern Israel on Sunday through a new agreement to bypass the Rafah crossing with Egypt after Israeli forces seized the Palestinian side of it earlier this month.
item.content:encoded:
Aid trucks entered Gaza from southern Israel on Sunday through a new agreement to bypass the Rafah crossing with Egypt after Israeli forces seized the Palestinian side of it earlier this month.

(Image credit: Ariel Schalit/AP)
item.dc:creator: Associated Press

item.title: At least 5 dead in Texas after severe weather hits Texas and Oklahoma
item.description: At least two people are dead after severe weather swept across Texas and Oklahoma overnight, causing extensive damage and outages, authorities said.
item.content:encoded:
At least two people are dead after severe weather swept across Texas and Oklahoma overnight, causing extensive damage and outages, authorities said.

(Image credit: Roy Dabner/AP)
item.dc:creator: Associated Press

item.title: Nicki Minaj concert postponed after she was detained in the Netherlands over cannabis
item.description: Nicki Minaj's concert in Manchester on Saturday night was postponed after police discovered marijuana in her bags as she was preparing to leave the country.
item.content:encoded:
Nicki Minaj's concert in Manchester on Saturday night was postponed after police discovered marijuana in her bags as she was preparing to leave the country.

(Image credit: Evan Agostini/Evan Agostini/Invision/AP)
item.dc:creator: Associated Press

item.title: UN estimates more than 670 killed in Papua New Guinea landslide
item.description: The International Organization for Migration on Sunday increased its estimate of the death toll from a massive landslide in Papua New Guinea to more than 670.
item.content:encoded:
The International Organization for Migration on Sunday increased its estimate of the death toll from a massive landslide in Papua New Guinea to more than 670.

(Image credit: Benjamin Sipa/AP)
item.dc:creator: Associated Press

item.title: Trump confronts repeated booing during Libertarian convention speech
item.description: Donald Trump was booed repeatedly while addressing the Libertarian Party National Convention on Saturday night, with many in the crowd shouting insults.
item.content:encoded:
Donald Trump was booed repeatedly while addressing the Libertarian Party National Convention on Saturday night, with many in the crowd shouting insults.

(Image credit: Jose Luis Magana/AP)
item.dc:creator: Associated Press

item.title: Grayson Murray, a 2-time PGA Tour winner, dies by suicide
item.description: Murray pulled out of the Charles Schwab Challenge in Fort Worth a day before his death. He spoke openly about his battle with mental health and excessive alcohol use.
item.content:encoded:
Murray pulled out of the Charles Schwab Challenge in Fort Worth a day before his death. He spoke openly about his battle with mental health and excessive alcohol use.

(Image credit: Matt York)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Disney composer Richard M. Sherman has died at 95
item.description: Sherman and his brother Robert became Disney Studios' first ever in-house songwriters. They won two Oscars for their songs and score to Mary Poppins and composed the classic "It's a Small World."
item.content:encoded:
Sherman and his brother Robert became Disney Studios' first ever in-house songwriters. They won two Oscars for their songs and score to Mary Poppins and composed the classic "It's a Small World."

(Image credit: Alberto E. Rodriguez)
item.dc:creator: Jeff Lunden

item.title: 'Anora' wins Palme d'Or at the 77th Cannes Film Festival
item.description: Sean Baker's dramedy starring Mikey Madison won the annual film festival's top honor.
item.content:encoded:
Anora, during the awards ceremony of the 77th international film festival in Cannes, southern France, on Saturday.'/>

Sean Baker's dramedy starring Mikey Madison won the annual film festival's top honor.

(Image credit: Andreea Alexandru)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman
